newsitem.title: UK: Prudential wins auction for ScotAm.
newsitem.headline: Prudential wins auction for ScotAm.

text.p: Mutually-owned insurance group Scottish Amicable said on Tuesday that Prudential Corp Plc had won the race to become the the preffered bidder for the group, beating out rivals Abbey National Plc and Australian Mutual Provident (AMP).
It said in a statement that it will demutualise and become a subsidiary of Prudential.
Scot Am said that with-profits policyholders would benefit from cash and additional policy benefits with a current value of more than 1.5 billion pounds ($2.4 billion).

These include 600 million pounds from Prudential shareholders' and policyholders' funds in compensation for loss of membership rights; a special reversionary bonus from ScotAm's life fund worth 470 million pounds; and the distribution of the entire remaining ScotAm life fund, estimated to have a current value of 500 million pounds.
On this basis, ScotAm with profits policy holders should receive total benefits of 1,400 pounds, varying according to the size and age of the policy.

Policyholders will also benefit from financial support to the tune of 1.3 billion pounds to boost ScotAm's life fund. ScotAm's original plan was to demutualise and float on the stock echange in two or three years time but the plan was thrown into confusion after Abbey National made a bid for the firm last month.
